name: Thoughtly
tag_list: quantified-self, personal-data, life-aggregator, ios, mobile, quantified-self-branding
overview:
Transforming Big Data Into Personalized Data

Imagine organizing comments and posts online, not by number of likes or followers, but by the caliber of the contributor. Tapping into the potential of big data, Thoughtly is creating an online world with new norms, where the highest-quality input is easily recognized and elevated. Thoughtly aggregates users’ relevant experience and embeds it into their digital signature. It is truly, the John Hancock of the future.

Thoughtly is a tool for the intellectually curious, the innovative and the insightful. These individuals can use Thoughtly to explore and express themselves anywhere online, thus curating content for the masses.

Thoughtly is an application tackling the realm of personal data aggregation. Thoughtly is a trailblazer in the personal data space, empowering individuals to display relevant experience based on consumable data. Thoughtly accounts for non-traditional data sources, like academic articles, career experience and reddit posts (while maintaining anonymity). These data sources are verifiable and consumable because of Thoughtly’s unique and proprietary approach to data aggregation.

Thoughtly is launching a beta version of its iOS app, demonstrating that dropping in a signature (that contains verified data) is a practical and revolutionary way to speak with credibility from a mobile device. A browser plugin will follow shortly after release of the Thoughtly iOS application, which will allow users to drop signatures anywhere on the web using a bookmarklet similar to Pinterest’s “pin it” feature.
